ch.zhaw.ba10_bsha_1.ime
Class HandwritingIME

java.lang.Object
  InputMethodService
      ch.zhaw.ba10_bsha_1.ime.HandwritingIME
All Implemented Interfaces:
IObserver
public class HandwritingIME
extends InputMethodService
implements IObserver

A basic implementation of the InputMethodService for our IME. Deals with the connection to the DetectionService and lets a PadView handle the gathering of the input data. Based on the SoftKeyboard example from the Android SDK.

Nested Class Summary
(package private)  class HandwritingIME.DetectionServiceConnection

Method Detail

onCreate

public void onCreate()
Main initialization of the input method component. Used to start the service if it's not already running.

onInitializeInterface

public void onInitializeInterface()
Initialization of the User Interface. It is called after creation and any configuration change.

onCreateInputView

public View onCreateInputView()
Called by the framework when the view for creating input needs to be generated. This will be called the first time the input method is displayed, and every time it needs to be re-created such as due to a configuration change.

onStartInputView

public void onStartInputView(EditorInfo attribute,
                             boolean restarting)
Called every time when the input method is shown, therefore we use this to bind to the Service.

onDestroy

public void onDestroy()
Called when the input method is destroy. Since there will be no input method around afterwards, we can use this to unbind the input method from the Service.

update

public void update(IObservable updater)
Deal with changes in the PadView, mostly relaying its input to the DetectionService

Specified by:
update in interface IObserver

onCreateCandidatesView

public View onCreateCandidatesView()
Called by the framework when the view for showing candidates needs to be generated, like onCreateInputView().

onStartInput

public void onStartInput(EditorInfo attribute,
                         boolean restarting)
This is the main point where we do our initialization of the input method to begin operating on an application. At this point we have been bound to the client, and are now receiving all of the detailed information about the target of our edits.

onFinishInput

public void onFinishInput()
This is called when the user is done editing a field. We can use this to reset our state.

onUpdateSelection

public void onUpdateSelection(int oldSelStart,
                              int oldSelEnd,
                              int newSelStart,
                              int newSelEnd,
                              int candidatesStart,
                              int candidatesEnd)
Deal with the editor reporting movement of its cursor.

onDisplayCompletions

public void onDisplayCompletions(CompletionInfo[] completion_infos)
This tells us about completions that the editor has determined based on the current text in it. We want to use this in fullscreen mode to show the completions ourself, since the editor can not be seen in that situation.

translateKeyDown

private boolean translateKeyDown(int keyCode,
                                 KeyEvent event)
This translates incoming hard key events in to edit operations on an InputConnection. It is only needed when using the PROCESS_HARD_KEYS option.

onKeyDown

public boolean onKeyDown(int keyCode,
                         KeyEvent event)
Use this to monitor key events being delivered to the application. We get first crack at them, and can either resume them or let them continue to the app.

onKeyUp

public boolean onKeyUp(int keyCode,
                       KeyEvent event)
Use this to monitor key events being delivered to the application. We get first crack at them, and can either resume them or let them continue to the app.
